<body>
    <div class="container">
        <h1>Aesthetics Streets Research Compendium</h1>
        <p>Research compendium to reproduce analyses of the article:</p>
        <p>Cirino D, Mouquet N, Metzger JP (2024) It is not only about green: modeling streetscapes aesthetic in a megacity. In prep.</p>
        <hr>
        <div class="section">
            <h2>General</h2>
            <p>This repository is structured as follows:</p>
            <ul>
                <li><strong>data/:</strong> contains data required to reproduce figures and tables</li>
                <li><strong>R/:</strong> contains R functions developed for this project</li>
                <li><strong>analyses/:</strong> contains R scripts to run specific analysis
                    <ul>
                        <li>Features_Analysis.R - code to analyze the features of the 420 street images used in the study</li>
                        <li>Social_characteristis_test.R - analyzes the effect of different social characteristics of the respondents in relation to the evaluation of the images on the survey</li>
                        <li>Elo_scores2.R - calculates the Elo's scores for each image, assuming that there is no difference between social characteristics</li>
                        <li>Modeling_final.R - statistical analysis between landscape, image features, and the scores of the images</li>
                        <li>correlation_GVI_Aesthetics.R - analysis of the correlation between green view index and aesthetics</li>
                        <li>GVI_Aesthetics_MAP.R - produces a biplot map between GVI and aesthetics - Fig. 8A</li>
                        <li>supply_demand.R - analysis of the supply of the aesthetical E.S. and the local demand. Produces the biplot between supply and demand - Fig. 5D</li>
                        <li>Google_streets.R - get the Google Street View images using the Google API and the R package googleway used for further extrapolation of the Elo scoring</li>
                    </ul>
                </li>
                <li><strong>results/:</strong> follows the structure of analyses. Contains intermediate results and the numeric results used to produce the figures.</li>
            </ul>
        </div>
        <hr>
        <div class="section">
            <h2>Storage</h2>
            <p>All the 420 images used for the survey and for the final statistical modeling are available on Flickr: <a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/197958479@N08/albums/72177720306842197" target="_blank">https://www.flickr.com/photos/197958479@N08/albums/72177720306842197</a></p>
            <p>All the images were resized and treated by the script <code>analysis/Images/Images.R</code></p>
        </div>
        <hr>
        <div class="section">
            <h2>Images Coordinates and Final Table with Modeling Information</h2>
            <p>The coordinates of each image are present in <code>data/dataBase_FINAL.csv</code>, with other information used for the modeling, such as the figure features, and the landscape metrics for each image/landscape.</p>
        </div>
        <hr>
    </div>
